text: Thomas 'Tom' Johnston Jr. (1933-2001) was a British greyhound trainer. He was twice UK Champion trainer in 1963 and 1972. ==Profile== Johnston's kennels were based at Stilliters Farm on Moulsoe Road in Cranfield, Bedfordshire. In 1963 he took over the kennels after moving from Scotland. His father Tom Johnston Sr. was the winning trainer of the 1928 English Greyhound Derby) and trained greyhounds on the coursing fields for Robert Jardine many years before oval track racing arrived to the United Kingdom. ==Racing career== He was a leading trainer for over a decade during the 1960s and 1970s and won the Scottish Greyhound Derby in 1963 and 1964. He ran out of West Ham Stadium until 1969 before joining Wembley Stadium where he trained until his retirement. He trained Westpark Mustard who broke the world record by winning twenty consecutive races 1974. He died in 2001 aged 68. == References == Category:British greyhound racing trainers Category:1933 births Category:2001 deaths
